net.hockeyapp.android

Class CrashManagerListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hockeyapp.android.CrashManagerListener

  • public abstract class CrashManagerListener
extends java.lang.Object

    Description

    Abstract class for callbacks to be invoked from the CrashManager.

      CrashManagerListener()

    • Constructor Detail

      • CrashManagerListener

        public CrashManagerListener()

    • Method Detail

      • ignoreDefaultHandler

        public boolean ignoreDefaultHandler()
        Return true to ignore the default exception handler, i.e. the user will not get the alert dialog with the "Force Close" button.
        Returns:
        if true, the default handler is ignored

      • includeDeviceData

        public boolean includeDeviceData()
        Return false to remove the device data (OS version, manufacturer, model) from the crash log, e.g. if some of your testers are using unreleased devices.
        Returns:
        if true, the crash report will include device data

      • includeDeviceIdentifier

        public boolean includeDeviceIdentifier()
        Return false to remove the stable device identifier from the crash log, e.g. if there are privacy concerns.
        Returns:
        if true, the crash report will include a stable device identifier

      • includeThreadDetails

        public boolean includeThreadDetails()
        Return true to include information about the crashed thread if available.
        Returns:
        if true, the crash report will include thread id and name if available

      • getContact

        public java.lang.String getContact()
        Return contact data or similar; note that this has privacy implications, so you might want to return nil for release builds! The string will be limited to 255 characters.
        Returns:
        the contact string

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Return additional data, i.e. parts of the system log, the last server response or similar. This string is not limited to a certain size.
        Returns:
        a description

      • getUserID

        public java.lang.String getUserID()
        Return a user ID or similar; note that this has privacy implications, so you might want to return nil for release builds! The string will be limited to 255 characters.
        Returns:
        the user's ID

      • onCrashesFound

        public boolean onCrashesFound()
        Deprecated. Replace this method with onNewCrashesFound, onConfirmedCrashesFound, and shouldAutoUploadCrashReport.
        Called when the crash manager found one or more crashes. Return true if you want to auto-send crashes (i.e. not ask the user)
        Returns:
        if true, crashes are sent automatically

      • shouldAutoUploadCrashes

        public boolean shouldAutoUploadCrashes()
        Return true if you want to auto-send crashes. Note that this method is only called if new crashes were found.
        Returns:
        if true, crashes are sent automatically

      • onNewCrashesFound

        public void onNewCrashesFound()
        Called when the crash manager has found new crash logs.

      • onConfirmedCrashesFound

        public void onConfirmedCrashesFound()
        Called when the crash manager has found crash logs that were already confirmed by the user or should have been auto uploaded, but the upload failed, e.g. in case of a network failure.

      • onCrashesSent

        public void onCrashesSent()
        Called when the crash manager has sent crashes to HockeyApp.

      • onCrashesNotSent

        public void onCrashesNotSent()
        Called when the crash manager failed to send crashes to HockeyApp, e.g. because the device has no network connections.

      • onUserDeniedCrashes

        public void onUserDeniedCrashes()
        Called when the user denied to send crashes to HockeyApp.

      • getMaxRetryAttempts

        public int getMaxRetryAttempts()
        Get the number of max retry attempts to send crashes to HockeyApp. Infinite retries if this value is set to -1
        Returns:
        the max number of retry attempts

      • onHandleAlertView

        public boolean onHandleAlertView()
        Called when dialog should be displayed to inform the user about crash.
        Returns:
        if true, alert-view is handled by user
